ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with a sleek, mobile-first interface for monitoring their computer's hardware performance remotely.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Futuristic mobile hardware monitoring dashboard â€¢ Integrates with LibreHardwareMonitor â€¢ Remote access to system statistics â€¢ Configurable device management â€¢ Svelte-based frontend
ðŸ“– Summary: CyberMon is a futuristic mobile hardware monitoring dashboard built with Svelte. It visualizes system statistics fetched from LibreHardwareMonitor, allowing users to remotely track their computer's hardware performance on their mobile devices.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Netflix-Prime-Auto-Skip | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide an uninterrupted streaming experience by automatically skipping non-essential content on various online streaming platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic skipping of ads, intros, recaps, and credits â€¢ Support for major streaming services like Netflix, Prime Video, Disney+, Crunchyroll, and HBO â€¢ Available as extensions for Chrome, Firefox, and Microsoft Edge â€¢ Installation support for Android via Firefox or Kiwi Browser
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides browser extensions for Chrome and Firefox that automatically skip advertisements, intros, recaps, and credits on major streaming services. It aims to enhance the viewing experience by removing unwanted interruptions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ alchemy | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Batch conversion and merging of files through a user-friendly menu bar application.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ File conversion â€¢ File merging (images to PDF) â€¢ Drag-and-drop interface â€¢ Batch processing â€¢ Menu bar application
ðŸ“– Summary: Alchemy is an open-source, menu-bar application built with Electron and React that allows users to easily convert and merge files. It provides a simple drag-and-drop interface for batch processing various file types, including merging images into a single PDF.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ windmouse | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Avoiding bot detection in automation scripts by simulating human-like mouse movements.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generates curved, natural-looking mouse paths â€¢ Varies movement speed dynamically â€¢ Supports AutoHotkey (Windows) and PyAutoGUI (cross-platform) backends â€¢ Allows fine-grained control over movement physics (gravity, wind, damping)
ðŸ“– Summary: WindMouse is a Python library designed to simulate human-like mouse movements, making automated actions less detectable by bot detection systems. It implements the WindMouse algorithm to create natural, non-linear paths with variable speeds, supporting both PyAutoGUI and AutoHotkey backends.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ui | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To showcase and provide examples of basic UI components for learning modern frontend development with HTML and CSS.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Examples of simple UI components â€¢ Modern Frontend Developer Ebook (almost 500 pages) â€¢ UI Components Collection â€¢ Frontend Resources â€¢ Quizzes And Certificate
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides examples of simple UI components built with HTML and CSS, serving as a learning resource for modern frontend development. It complements a broader course offering that includes an ebook, interactive tutorials, and quizzes.
